Case reference: 2014004316.CaseDesc: Trevor Angell was last heard from on September 22, 2000. Mr. Angell is a truck driver who was taking a load from Calgary, Alberta to Los Angeles, California.  His truck was located on September 25, 2000 in Primm, Nevada, USA.

Case reference: 2012020092.CaseDesc: Edward Keith Geddes was last seen sometime mid April, 2011, in the community of Neilburg, Saskatchewan. Mr. Geddes has been known to travel between Manitoba and British Columbia, and has been employed in the auto repair industry. Mr. Geddes does not have a vehicle associated to him as he was known to buy and sell vehicles on a regular basis.

Case reference: 2014004654.CaseDesc: Richard Brokke was last seen at approximately 8:10 a.m. on July 15, 2005 leaving the 7-11 Store on St. Mary's Road in Winnipeg. His vehicle was located on July 19, 2005 near St. Jean Baptiste, Manitoba. Mr. Brokke's whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, White, Green, Golf shirt with green stripes on front

Case reference: 2020008397.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1981, Brian Orr was last seen by his parents in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Brian’s parents believe that he was in financial troubles.

Scar: Lower Left Back, 3 inches in length and half an inch wide
Right Eye, From nose to cheek bone on right eyelid

Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2014001859.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1997, Wendy Ratte was reported missing by her daughter. Mrs. Ratte was last seen on August 18, at 3pm. Her vehicle was found, locked, in a grocery store parking lot. Investigations led to a conviction in 2010, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2013000138.CaseDesc: Peter Limberis was last seen in Trail BC on July 20, 2005. He left Trail on his way to Saskatchewan, driving in his white 2003 Saturn Vue with Saskatchewan licence plate 850ENA. Mr. Limberis was also travelling with his dog, a white and brown smooth haired Fox Terrier named Pedro.

Chain: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, chain
Shirt: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Jersey
Watch: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Pants: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Track
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Jail house noose

Case reference: 2021024071.CaseDesc: On April 19, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered in the woods east of Huntsville, Ontario. A vape, cigarette filter and four medical diagnostic tabs were located nearby.

Case reference: 2017070398.CaseDesc: Randy Whitcher was seen for the last time on November 29, 2017 at approximately 10 a.m. in the 11000 Block of the Westminster Highway in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2011000399.CaseDesc: Kathy Bordato was reported missing in early February, 2010.  Police believe that she was last seen on or about August 16, 2009, between 7:00 and 8:30 am in the area of Cavendish Park near Walnut Street in London, Ontario. Police conducted a search of the area where Ms. Bordato was last seen and believe there are still witnesses with information to offer in relation to the investigation.

Tattoo: Left Hand, Tattoo of female  symbol between thumb and finger, left hand

Case reference: 2019044701.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2019, at approximately 6:00 am, Bridget Dalbe was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2007002799.CaseDesc: Amanda Rudge was last seen by her mother at her residence on Enfield Place, Mississauga in August of 1991. At the time she went missing, Amanda was known to frequent the Bloor and Landsdowne area of Toronto. Amanda may have connections to the United States.

Hair: Auburn, Other, Natural Auburn dyed Blonde
Teeth: Broken Front Tooth which had been fixed
Pierce: Ears, Several piercings in both ears
Tattoo: Left Foot, APBT letters on her left toes

Case reference: 2020019009.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2020, Sameer Patel was seen for the last time by his friends when he accidentally fell into the Niagara River located in Ontario, while hiking.

Case reference: 2008016399.CaseDesc: Nikki Lysanewitch has been missing since July 1994.  He was last seen leaving his residence near Bobcaygeon, Ontario.  His pick-up truck was later found parked at the Toronto International Airport.

Case reference: 2014004138.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2002, Sefacag Erdinc was last seen at his residence in Mission, British Columbia. Since then, Mr. Erdinc has not been seen or heard from.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Moon and Star

Case reference: 2014005364.CaseDesc: Antoinette Neveu was reported missing on January 11, 1991, after failing to arrive at her place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020051250.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1983, an unidentified woman died. Shortly before her death, she was observed in the Montreal, Quebec area.

Case reference: 2014001146.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1974, the  remains of an adult male were found near Union Bar Road in Hope, British Columbia. He was 30-49 years old, had five simple dental restorations on the lower teeth and it is believed that he would have gone missing two to twenty years before his remains were located.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2016047824.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2016, Marie-Claude Hebert was last seen leaving her residence, on foot, on St-Calixte Street in Plessisville, Quebec. She has not been seen since.

Sweater: Cotton, Black, Unknown logo on the front

Case reference: 2014003608.CaseDesc: Brianne Wolgram was last seen on the evening of September 5, 1998, in Revelstoke, British Columbia.  Ms. Wolgram had plans to socialize with friends that evening but did not attend.  Ms. Wolgram's vehicle was located on September 10, 1998 on the Alkolkolex Forest Service Road near Revelstoke.

Case reference: 2016070214.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1975, the remains of a female were discovered in the North Saskatchewan River near the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta. The individual had had extensive dental work and had an ‘X’ shaped scar on her left wrist.

Shoes: White, Blue, RUNNERS, White with blue stripe around upper edge of sole
Sweater: White, Pink, White with horizontal pink stripes
Pants: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, PANTY HOSE

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2014001032.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1999, a man committed suicide in front of a train near Wellington Street on the Lachine Canal. He was found lying on the railroad tracks.

Mark: Left Knee, erosion of the knee
Right Knee, erosion of the knee

Case reference: 2014004874.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2006, Tracy Forde was seen for the last time at her home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009002399.CaseDesc: On Friday, April 21, 1972, Francis Harris went to a medical appointment with her husband in Peterborough. On the way home to Apsley, they stopped in Lakefield and she may have gone to the post office and the bank. They arrived home around 11:00 a.m. and ate lunch. Her husband went to work from approximately 1:00 p.m. to 5:05 p.m.  When their son returned home from school at about 3:40 p.m., Mrs. Harris was not home.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Wavy, may have been dyed black
Ring: White gold engagement and wedding ring

Case reference: 2014005123.CaseDesc: On Friday October 26, 1984, David Campbell and his friends went to a Halloween party at Simon Fraser University, Burnaby, BC. Later that night, an anonymous person informed that he observed David departing the party with four Asian males during an altercation. He has not been seen since that night.

Hat: Straw, Yellow, Fedora with a black ribbon around it

Case reference: 2008021099.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1966, Diane Prevost was seen for the last time as she was camping at Grundy Provincial Park in Britt, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Diane had been playing on the beach, and had told her father that she wanted to go back to the campsite. When her father turned to do so, she was gone.

Shirt: Blue, Red, checked top with red at cuffs and collar

Case reference: 2012020057.CaseDesc: Peter Halcrow was last seen on March 14, 1994 walking in the "Sawmill" area between 14:00 and 15:00.  Mr. Halcrow has not been seen since.

Shoes: Leather, Green, White, Reebok with purple

Case reference: 2014001925.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1976, Maggie Natomagan, 74 years old, was last seen in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. Mrs. Natomagan was known to walk in the bush near the community, however, searches failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2014003765.CaseDesc: Mr. Hicks walked away from his temporary residence during the morning of August 11, 1994, leaving his wallet behind. He never returned. Neil is believed to suffer from mental health issues and was prescribed medication.

Case reference: 2020010931.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1987, at approximately 10:20am, Farad Khan was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Farad had left his home following an argument with his wife.

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2014004965.CaseDesc: Cecilia Nikal arrived in Vancouver to visit her mother on August 1, 1989; she then left her mother's house to live on the streets. She was last seen by her mother in October of 1989. A report by a family member that Ms. Nikal had subsequently moved to Vancouver Island was never confirmed.

Case reference: 2014005579.CaseDesc: In the early hours of January 17, 1991, Darrell Watt was seen for the last time as he left the Beverly Crest Hotel tavern in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of his disappearance, Darrell was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and was a known associate of a motorcycle club.

Case reference: 2017057938.CaseDesc: On April 23, 2016, this man jumped in front of a metro train at the Charlevoix station in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2016068714.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1967, the remains of a female were recovered from the Niagara River. Her post-mortem length was measured at 5’1”-5’2”, however, this measurement may not represent her actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Her appendix was present. The body is believed to have been in the water for some months to years prior to recovery.

Case reference: 1999003370.CaseDesc: Nancy Liou was last seen at home on January 27, 1999. On January 28, her father contacted Nancy's school to see if she was there, and was advised they had no way of knowing if she was in attendance as it was exam time. Her father contacted police that evening when she failed to return home from school.  She had advised a family member she was leaving but never said where she was headed.

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Shoes: Black, sandals; velcro straps; size 9; navy blue, grey and black swirls
Backpack: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Mountain Equipment Coop
Glasses: Bronze, octagon shaped, wire rimmed, prescription

Case reference: 2014002919.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1988, Andrée Thibault was seen for the last time the Sainte-Marie District in Montreal, Quebec. Andrée may have been seen in Western Canada in the Vancouver, British-Columbia area.

Case reference: 2017040839.CaseDesc: Claude Lévesque was last seen on July 17, 2017, in the Mercier/Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sector of Montreal. He had an appointment with his Doctor that afternoon, yet he never showed up. He is known to be despondent.

Scar: Right Forearm, Front of arm, wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2017018201.CaseDesc: Happy Charles, 42 years old, was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, the evening of April 3rd, 2017. Happy was in frequent contact with her family in La Ronge, Saskatchewan, and had plans to seek treatment for drug addiction.

Jewelry: Grey, small silver locket with a picture of son
Purse: light in color with long straps
Jacket: Leather, Black, worn under long wool coat
Black, long wool coat worn over leather jacket
Pants: Denim, Blue, wears jeans under sweatpants

Case reference: 2009004199.CaseDesc: Manou Sokpor was reported missing to police by his fiancée. She had last spoken with Manou at 2:00 a.m. on May 14th, 2009 by telephone; nothing seemed out of the ordinary. His fiancée had no further contact with Manou the rest of that day which was out of his character. On May 15th the vehicle Manou usually drove was located in his driveway, and his wallet and cellular phone were in the bedroom.

Teeth: Visible Missing, First or second molar upper left jaw, gap in front teeth.

Case reference: 2014002041.CaseDesc: Sometime over the night of November 19 to 20, 1999, Mathieu Parent was seen for the last time leaving the Dagobert night club in Quebec, Quebec. His family has not heard from him since.

Shoes: Blue, Yellow, With fluorescent yellow lines
Pants: Nylon, Dark Blue, With white lines on the sides
Sweater: Cotton, Light Blue, Fubu, Long sleeves

Case reference: 2011000699.CaseDesc: On 23 May 1985, William Drake walked out of the Pinecrest Home for senior citizens, where he lived.  He was last seen at 9:30 am walking eastbound on highway 17 in Kenora, near the Sunset Husky gas station.  His family and friends have not heard from him since. Mr. Drake is reported to be hard of hearing and diabetic.

Pants: Light Blue, small checks and suspenders

Case reference: 2006005099.CaseDesc: Gary Millerson was last seen at his residence in Port McNicoll on the 19 April 1991.

Case reference: 2006007399.CaseDesc: On January 5, 1991 Bruce Blimkie left the Riverview Inn in Norway Bay, Quebec, to travel home by snowmobile, across the Ottawa River, to Arnprior, Ontario.  It is believed that Mr. Blimkie was travelling in an area of the Ottawa River where there was open water, and that his snowmobile went through the ice into the water. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016068154.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from Gough Creek at the east end of Queen Street, in Kapuskasing. This area is known to have been used by vagrants and others as a place for consuming alcohol. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 10 days prior to discovery.

Teeth: Several of his teeth are missing and he has cavities

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2020010776.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1968, Samuel Hall was seen for the last time when he went out onto Lake Ontario for a fishing trip. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Blue, Grey, Work, Emblem with the letters "BA"

Case reference: 2012020115.CaseDesc: Glen Moquin was last seen at a summer camp in Abitibi on August 9th, 1993.  His clothes were located on the shore of the lake.

Case reference: 2014001124.CaseDesc: The skeletal skull of a young middle-aged woman was found by a hunter on September 10, 1994, in a wooded area east of Golden, British Columbia. She may have had a dental overlap at the front and would have died about 5 years earlier.

Case reference: 2014005219.CaseDesc: Lori Lee Berens was last seen January 15, 1985 in the Winnipeg area. Lori has not made contact with her family since then and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Often wore a ponytail

Case reference: 2014005346.CaseDesc: In August of 1987, Dale Sinclair was last seen as he left his home in Edmonton, Alberta, driving his wife’s vehicle. Dale had planned to cash a cheque at the bank, and then intended on visiting family in Gibbons, Alberta. On August 12, 1987, the vehicle he was driving was recovered by the police in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2005004599.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1996, an unidentified man, believed to be Caucasian was recovered from the Sir Adam Beck Dam in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10" to 5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has evidence of heart disease and may have had heart problems in the past. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days up to two weeks prior to discovery. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Long, Long grey and white beard 12cm
Teeth: No upper teeth and no lower posterior teeth; remaining teeth have roots only; crowns are lost due to decay.

Case reference: 2014003280.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1998, Peter Dekoning was reported missing after failing to return home from making his restaurant deliveries. He was last seen at Jackfish Lake near Two Hills where he was believed to have stayed for several days. His vehicle was located near the North Saskatchewan river with the keys missing. There was no sign of foul play. A search of land and water was unsuccessful.

Pants: Dark Blue, Black, pants were either dark blue or black
Scar: Jaw, long white scar down right side of chin

Case reference: 2018041446.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1998, Richard Opato was last known to be in the region of Niagara Falls, Ontario at approximately 5:30 p.m. There has been no news of his whereabouts or well being since this time.

Hair: Brown, Short, Other, Losing hair on the top of his head

Case reference: 2018041855.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1992, Grayce Baxter was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. She was a known transgendered sex trade worker. She had a transaction with Patrick Johnson who subsequently confessed to her homicide. Grayce’s remains were never recovered.

Coat: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Fur, Full length coat

Case reference: 2014001690.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1971, James MacDonald departed Thompson, Manitoba in his "Money Mark 21" aircraft bound for Winnipeg. James never arrived. Despite intensive air search neither Mr. MacDonald nor his aircraft have been located.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, engineering ring
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Calendar watch

Case reference: 2014004061.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1984, Robert Dwyer was seen for the last time when he left his residence at the Keirstead Trailer Park, which is located on the west side of Saint John, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Grey, Bomber, dark grey corduroy front

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2014003643.CaseDesc: Dean Mortensen was reported missing on January 24, 1992, after he failed to attend his classes at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Alberta. Dean was last seen by his friends leaving the on campus bar, The Ship. They parted ways with him within 200 metres of his dorm room at the St. Joseph's College that night.

Jacket: Grande Cache Bantam Elks leather hockey jacket with gold shoulders, white collar, "Dean" on sleeve
Shirt: ST JOSEPH, St. Joseph crest on front

Case reference: 2012001299.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1991, a male was found on the shoreline of Sandy Beach in Michipicoten Harbour, Lake Superior, near Wawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead from a few weeks to a few months.

Scar: Upper Back, 1.3 cm midline circular scar
Right Abdomen, 6 cm scar, possible hernia repair
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, Plate with 5 screws, healed/old

Case reference: 2014004798.CaseDesc: On the 25th of October, 1954, Tersilla Bonthoux, 79 years old, was last seen walking from Duck Lake towards the farm homestead where she used to reside, approximately 13 km away. Ms. Bonthoux was reported missing and extensive searches of the area failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2019029100.CaseDesc: Robert Allen Wetsch was reported missing by family on May 19, 2019. There have not been any confirmed sightings of him since.

Case reference: 2014003990.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, Yashar Ilkay and his wife went to bed for the night. When Yashar’s wife woke up in the morning, her husband was no longer in the residence. He left his residence without his glasses, dentures and money. Mr. Ilkay was last seen in Moncton downtown area.

Shirt: brown, white and blue long sleeve shirt

Case reference: 2020008363.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1981, at approximately 1:00pm, Dick Yeagar was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Dick had been evicted from his apartment on August 15, and did not show up to work the following day.

Case reference: 2019056482.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 26, 2019, Gregory Paul Agnew was seen for the last time in his green Pontiac Sunfire, leaving a mushroom picker’s camp located at the 11km mark on the Kinsckutch Forest Service Road in New Aiyansh, to run errands in Terrace, British Columbia. On the evening of September 27, 2019, the Pontiac Sunfire was observed at his campsite along with his camper van, but Gregory was not there. An extensive search of the area was conducted with no success. Gregory has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006021699.CaseDesc: Karl Anderson was last seen on September 3, 1974 in Upsala, Ontario. It was thought that he possibly travelled by train to Sioux Lookout or Thunder Bay to seek medical treatment.

Case reference: 2020007826.CaseDesc: Gerhart Kiel was reported missing from his residence in Minburn, Alberta. His vehicle, a dark grey 2009 Ford Ranger which has a truck bed cover in the same colour, was also reported missing from his residence. Gerhart has not had any contact with his family since November 23, 2019.

Case reference: 2014001281.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1982, a volunteer with Meals on Wheels reported to the police that, despite numerous attempts, they had not been able to contact Thelma Haskins. Police checked her home, however she was not there and they found nothing suspicious.  None of Mrs. Haskins' friends had seen her, and she had not frequented any local businesses.  Ground searches of the area and of the walking trails Mrs. Haskins frequented did not reveal any trace of her.  Mrs. Haskins has not been located.

Hair: Black, Short, hair is turning grey

Case reference: 2000000183.CaseDesc: Matthew was last seen at a truck stop in Sicamous in British Columbia, Canada.

Case reference: 2014005817.CaseDesc: On January 13, 2008, August Mikson was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018045820.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1994, at approximately 1:30 pm, Subarangit Rajanehru was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002458.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1986, Rozebeh Kiani was seen for the last time in the Shaughnessy Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Rozebeh left all his personal belongings behind in his apartment and it is possible he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Kiani speaks very little French or English.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2008020199.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1973, Donald MacGregor was seen for the last time in Miami, Florida, after leaving for a business trip to Panama City in Panama.

Case reference: 2012020179.CaseDesc: This adult Caucasian female was recovered from a freight yard north of 127 Water Street. in Vancouver.

Case reference: 2020011631.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1975, at approximately 8:30 am, Simon Wilson was seen for the last time as he left his home for school in Toronto, Ontario. Simon did not arrive at school.

Case reference: 2013000130.CaseDesc: Norman Rivet was last seen on May 24, 1983 at home in Ville-Émard, a neighbourhood of Montreal.  He left a suicide note to his family.

Case reference: 2014003729.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1997, Céline Mercier was seen for the last time at her home in Levis, Quebec. Her vehicle was recovered near the Pierre-Laporte Bridge, which spans the cities of Levis and Quebec. Céline hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005303.CaseDesc: On November 7th, 2008, Van Do was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Mr. Do had indicated that he was intending to travel to Kitchener, Ontario to visit his friends. His wallet, bankcards and a packed suitcase were found in his home.

Case reference: 2014000003.CaseDesc: The Toronto Police Service is seeking assistance in solving a missing person case.  Mr. Sandhu left his home located in the North West area of Toronto in February of 2004 and never returned.  His family is desperately seeking answers.  Please contact the Toronto Police Service with any information that may assist in locating Mr. Sandhu.

Jacket: Cotton, Black, waist length; zippered front
Scar: Nose, Small scar on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2006026899.CaseDesc: Dr. Kemp left his residence in Sturgeon Falls, on May 19, 1960, to go fishing. On May 20, 1960, he failed to return home and was reported missing. On May 21, 1960, his vehicle was found parked at Finlayson Lake, McLaren Township, District of Nipissing. His canoe and personal belongings were located on the lake.

Case reference: 2014046601.CaseDesc: Jason Beaupit has not been in contact with his family since September 2014. Mr. Beaupit was last seen on October 19, 2014, at a shelter in downtown Edmonton. He is known to travel and camp throughout British Columbia and Alberta.

Case reference: 2020010906.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1987, at approximately 7:00am, Christopher Dodd was seen for the last time in Toronto. His vehicle was subsequently located in an impound lot in New York, USA.

Case reference: 2016065871.CaseDesc:
On May 10, 1973, a male, approximately 170 lbs., 5'6"-5'8" in height, robbed the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce on Main Street South in Kenora. He was subsequently shot by police upon getaway which detonated the explosive device that was carried on his body. 
It was later determined that this individual had spent 2 days at the hotel between April 23 and 25, checking-in under the name of "Paul Higgins, 435 Glen Dr., Toronto". Upon check-out, he apparently took a bus to Winnipeg but arranged to have his steamer trunk stored at the hotel. He checked back into the hotel on May 5. The steamer trunk was found in his room following the robbery along with items that were disposed of by the Armed Forces Demolition Unit. The remains of Old Port, Dutch Prince and Teuros-Havanas cigars and cigar packages were also found in his room. The name and address that this individual provided upon check-in were followed-up with negative results.

Boots: Size 10 Chippewa bush boots with 1" thick insole

Case reference: 2014004969.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1966, a friend asked Ronnie Harper to help him lift one of his nets out of the waters of Red Sucker Lake. The two men set off in a canoe. When they arrived at the site, the men pulled the line attached to the net, but it didn't move. Increasing their efforts, the men pulled harder and the line attached to the weight came loose. The sudden shift caused both men to lose their footing and the canoe to overturn. The men attempted to move closer to shore by pushing the canoe. After a time, Mr. Harper told his friend he was too tired to hold on any longer. His companion continued moving the canoe. The survivor then realized Mr. Harper was no longer hanging on. Efforts to locate Mr. Harper were unsuccessful and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2018000324.CaseDesc: Freda Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton at the York Hotel on October 6, 2006.

Case reference: 2016061153.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1996, a male was found on the shores of the Detroit River in the 800 block of Front Road North, Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as balding, however, due to the length of time spent in the water, it is possible that his hair was lost after death giving the appearance of male pattern baldness. He is uncircumcised. His appendix is present. Changes to his heart suggest that he had high blood pressure and may have been treated for this. It is believed that he was in the water for days to weeks prior to his discovery.

Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Knights of Round Table, polo
Jewelry: Gold, Timex, watch with a gold-plated spandex band on his left wrist
Scar: Forehead, 3.8 cm on the right side

Case reference: 2018015227.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, at approximately 1:00pm, Maria Ruiz Zein was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Maria boarded a flight to go to Colombia, but has not returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001638.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1977, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Norman Louison was last seen walking to a residence on the Cowessess First Nation near Broadview, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2017041321.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2017, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Dennis Tuyshime was seen for the last time in Québec City, Québec.

Case reference: 2006005199.CaseDesc: On Friday, July 1, 2005, at about 3:00 p.m., Laura Flanagan left her cottage to paddle her canoe around Hall's Lake. She was seen by neighbours to be alone in the canoe. A search of the lake located her canoe washed up on the east side of the lake. A further search of the lake failed to locate Ms. Flanagan.

Bathing Suit: Blue, Green, One piece, floral pattern

Case reference: 2018004583.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1953, Marion McDowell was seen for the last time in a parked car in lover’s lane in Scarborough, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, an unknown man opened the car door, and assaulted Marion’s date rendering him unconscious. When he regained consciousness, she was gone.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With a heart

Case reference: 2014002901.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1981, Carlos Yuste was residing with friends in Thompson, Manitoba. He departed the residence and never returned. Carlos left behind all his clothing and personal belongings. He was described by his friends as being very depressed due to his unemployment. Mr. Yuste has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Aliases: GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel
YUSTE GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.
